newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Wolters buys Time Warner unit.
newsitem.headline: Wolters buys Time Warner unit.

text.p: Dutch publisher Wolters Kluwer NV said on Wednesday it had acquired Little, Brown and Company -- a medical and legal publisher -- from Time Warner Inc.
It gave no financial details of the deal which it said was expected to be completed in September.
Wolters Kluwer said Boston-based Little, Brown and Company generated annual sales of some $50 million, distributing information both via traditional print media and electronically.
The Dutch company said Little, Brown and Co's legal and tax publications would be integrated with those of its own U.S. legal/tax subsidiary Aspen Publishers.
Its medical publications will be integrated with those of Wolters Kluwer's U.S. medical subsidiary Lippincott-Raven.
Wolters Kluwer said the acquisition would strengthen its position as the leading medical publisher in the U.S. where it also owns medical publisher Facts and Comparisons.
A Wolters Kluwer spokeswoman said the acquisition related solely to the professional publishing activities of Little, Brown and Company and did not include its consumer publishing business.
The sales figure cited by Wolters Kluwer referred solely to the professional publishing activities of Little, Brown and Company, she added.
